Francis Bacon's key contribution to philosophy was in the field of epistemology. He believed that human knowledge is generated by observation and reason, though eventually he held a critical standpoint on the validity of the senses. He grounded his epistemology in ontology, forming the holistic creed that the senses inform understanding more accurately than reason, which ultimately leads to a shared human understanding. He contended that, "No one has a perfect understanding of the object because we all perceive differently
